title: Frame extraction not equal to that specified in config.yaml
body:
OS: Windows 10 DeepLabCut Version: 2.1.6 Anaconda env used: conda **Describe the problem** After I created my project and loaded my video, I tried to extract 500 frames, but the total frames loaded in the "label frames" GUI shows only 260.
Code output

```python Config file read successfully. Do you want to extract (perhaps additional) frames for video: /projectnb2/hasselmogrp/pnambiar/dlc/rat113020red-pranav-2020-11-30/videos/HSDR-112420_red_1.wmv ? yes/noyes Extracting frames based on kmeans ... Kmeans-quantization based extracting of frames from 0.0 seconds to 630.12 seconds. Extracting and downsampling... 630121 frames from the video. 630121it [25:19, 414.71it/s] Kmeans clustering ... (this might take a while) /projectnb/hasselmogrp/.conda/envs/DLC-GPU-DC/lib/python3.7/site-packages/sklearn/cluster/_kmeans.py:1676: RuntimeWarning: init_size=300 should be larger than k=500. Setting it to 3*k init_size=init_size) /projectnb/hasselmogrp/.conda/envs/DLC-GPU-DC/lib/python3.7/site-packages/sklearn/cluster/_kmeans.py:1676: RuntimeWarning: init_size=300 should be larger than k=500. Setting it to 3*k init_size=init_size) /projectnb/hasselmogrp/.conda/envs/DLC-GPU-DC/lib/python3.7/site-packages/sklearn/cluster/_kmeans.py:1676: RuntimeWarning: init_size=300 should be larger than k=500. Setting it to 3*k init_size=init_size) Frame 630119 not found! Frames were successfully extracted. ``` You can now label the frames using the function 'label_frames' (if you extracted enough frames for all videos).

**How to Reproduce the problem** Steps to reproduce the behavior: 1. Open DLC 2. Create project and edit config.yaml to include numframes2pick = 500 3. Extract frames 4. Load frames for labeling 5. See 260 total frames **Screenshots** ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/18171814/101211924-e9516100-3645-11eb-937b-d8298acfb872.png) ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/18171814/101212204-5533c980-3646-11eb-81ba-f829f5a3d5eb.png)
